Excelente juego

Nice but short follow-up on HL2 main game story.

The episode 1 follows the adventures of Gordon Freeman, and take over just after the end of HL2.

It's using the same engine, so nothing new here. The game spreads over 5 chapters, so it's quite quick to finish, but still pleasant.

I do recommend it for anyone looking to continue the story of Gordon Freeman !

Episode One is actually a misnomer.
You see there was a game before this that was simply called Half-Life 2.
That would technically make this episode two.

They really should have thought about this, imagine some poor gamer finishing the first Half-Life and, seeing that there are multiple episodes for Half-Life 2, starting at the logical first game Half-Life 2: Episode One.
Oh how confused they would be. Where am I? Why do I have a sidekick now? Why is the robot gorilla called "Dog"?
I really didn't enjoy this... The only reason i stuck around is cause it's GORDON F UCKING FREEMAN!
Wished it could had been longer or had a tad bit more variety in enemies (like half of them are antlions or zombies)

Half-Life 2: Episode One
Продолжение одного из лучших шутеров в истории игровой индустрии. игра поделена на эпизоды. 
Первый эпизод начинается там, где закончился оригинальный Half-Life 2.

Короткая продолжительность кампании (в среднем 3-4 часов).

Сюжет, раскрывающий некоторые подробности скрытые в оригинале.

Графика, которая хороша, но изменения минимальны и сводятся в основном к освещению.

Весь эпизод нас будет сопровождать Аликс, которая может перебить врагов без вас.

Появился новый враг зомбайн(солдат Альянса с хэдкрабом), сталкер(их можно не трогать).

В эпизоде возросла динамика геймплея. Благодаря Аликс.

По итогу: Отличный аддон с минимальными изменениями.
я рекомендую божественно

(My logged hours on this game are significantly less than reality, given that Steam does not recognise MMod as a first party modification).

Half-Life 2: Episode One was a great standalone Addon to an even greater base game back in the day and even to this day has very solid gameplay. Visually it also aged quite well if played at 4K.

The standalone isn't particularly long, but it isn't particularly expensive either and it does provide sufficient content for its asking price.

In terms of gameplay there are a few new things, although the story is quite railroaded and does not necessarily feel very fluent in terms of narrative due to the large amount of very different levels without any real logical explanation for the variety. This is clearly not a flaw, but it does feel as if they had initially planned more content and then scrapped a bit of that and made transitions between different "biomes" a lot shorter than would feel natural. That's complaining from a very high horse though.

Back then it was brilliant, today it is still good and worth to be played. There's little sense to play this without having played Half-Life 2 though, as it is a literally direct on the spot continuation of the ending of HL 2.

Half-Life 2 Episode One é um dos três pacotes de expansão desenvolvidos para complementar a história de Half-Life 2, lançado em Junho de 2006 pela Valve Corporation.
  O jogo começa seu enredo imediatamente após o fim de Half-Life 2, dando um significado para todas as questões que haviam sido deixadas no ar pelo misterioso final do jogo.

  Prós:
  [list]
  [*]Enredo simples, mas coeso com o apresentado anteriormente pela franquia.
  [*]Aumento de certas mecânicas de combate, aprimorando armas com a [i]Gravity Gun[/i] e a interação da mesma com objetos do cenário, sendo eles mais presentes e diversos por toda parte do jogo.
 [/list]

  Contras:
  [list]
  [*]Ocasionais Bugs de texturas em áreas com pouca iluminação.
  [*]Ocasionais falhas na Inteligência Artificial do jogo.
 [/list]

  Half-Life 2 Episode One apresenta poucas evoluções mecânicas, gráficas e tecnológicas considerando seu antecessor, no entanto traz desafios novos e inovadores para a franquia acrescendo nos [i]puzzles[/i] característicos da franquia, além de trazer a continuação da trajetória de Gordon Freeman.
  
  [b]Nota: 8,5[/b]
